node.title: Can tattoos really be a cancer risk? Experts say ink bans are necessary but there are shades of grey
node.alt: A man in a mask lies on his back getting his arm tattooed.
node.description: An EU law came into force this week banning the use of many popular tattoo inks that contain chemicals regulators say are hazardous, with some linked to cancer. Tattoo artists are up in arms, but experts say Australia should be getting on board.
node.content:
["Typically, tattoo regret is the name of an ex branded across your\u00a0chest,\u00a0or a 2003 tribal symbol stamped on your\u00a0lower back.", "When going under the tattoo gun, it's unlikely you would be thinking about a potential cancer risk.", "But it's something European Union (EU) regulators have been\u00a0worried enough about to ban some of the most popular tattoo inks \u2014\u00a0sparking an angry reaction from tattooists.", "One artist\u00a0described the move as like \"taking the flour from a bakery\" while a\u00a0Save the Pigments\u00a0petition,\u00a0which has already collected 176,000 signatures, opposes\u00a0the ban, saying it is not sufficiently backed by science.", "Meanwhile, in Australia, tattoo and body art inks remain largely unregulated.", "The EU new law, which came into force this week, limits the use of chemicals that the European Chemicals Agency (ECHA) says are hazardous.", "Some of those\u00a0linked to cancer, reproductive difficulties and skin irritation\u00a0are contained in mixtures for\u00a0tattoo\u00a0inks and permanent make-up (PMU).", "After conducting an assessment into the health risks of chemicals in tattoo inks, the ECHA concluded that the use of some 4,000 chemicals should be limited, including\u00a0\u00a0isopropanol alcohol which is a common ingredient in inks.", "The ECHA report notes that there is currently no direct evidence of tattoo ink causing cancer, but research has found instances of pigment particles from the inks spreading into people's lymph nodes.", "Under the regulation, a range of pigments must no longer be used, while others must meet concentration limits\u00a0for groups of substances or individual substances.", "Considering that at least 12 per cent of Europeans have tattoos \u2013 at least 54 million people \u2013\u00a0and double that number in the 18-35 age group, the ECHA says the guidelines are necessary.", "\"The aim is not to ban tattooing but to make the colours used in tattoos and permanent make-up safer,\" the ECHA said.", "It expects \"chronic allergic reactions and other inflammatory skin reactions\" to decrease due to the restrictions.\u00a0", "", "
Chemicals found in thousands of colour inks have been deemed hazardous by the EU regulators.\u00a0(ABC News: Tim Swanston)
", "
'A rose with brown leaves is a lot less attractive'
", "Tattoo\u00a0artists argue the inks\u00a0have been in circulation for decades and alternatives do not yet exist or are in short supply, and the law deals a blow to an industry already reeling after repeated lockdowns.", "The law was agreed in December 2020 but the industry was given a year to adjust and find alternatives.", "An extra year has been given to find alternatives for\u00a0Pigment Blue 15\u00a0and\u00a0Pigment Green 7, which have been the focus of the Save the Pigments petition as they are more difficult to replace.\u00a0", "Tycho Veldhoen, a tattoo artist in Amsterdam who has spent a quarter century in the profession, fears there will be an \"enormous impact\" on his work once certain colours are banned.", "\"Because, like a painter, you suddenly lose a gigantic part of your palette,\" he said.", "\"A rose with brown leaves is a lot less attractive than a rose with green leaves.\"", "", "
The EU law was agreed in December 2020 but the industry was given a year to adjust and find alternatives.(Reuters: Sarah Meyssonnier)
", "
Should Australians be worried about risks?
", "In Australia, where according to the latest Australian National Health and Medical Research Council data, one in seven\u00a0people are now \"inked\", body art tattoo inks and\u00a0PMU pigments\u00a0are currently unregulated in all jurisdictions.\u00a0", "This is despite Australian research that some of the chemicals may be harmful.", "In 2016, a report by the Australian Industrial Chemicals Introduction Scheme (AICIS\u00a0) found that one in five tattoo inks used in Australia contain polycyclic aromatic hydrocarbons (PAHs), a group of chemicals\u00a0known to be carcinogens.", "PAHs were found in more than one-fifth of the samples tested and in 83 per cent of the black inks tested.", "Of the 49 inks NICNAS tested, only four complied with the\u00a0European standards.", "No inks are made in Australia with\u00a0all of them imported, typically from Europe, the US and China.\u00a0", "The Australian Cancer Council says while it is \"not aware of a reported cancer case directly attributable to tattooing\", it acknowledges the evidence that some tattoo\u00a0inks contain\u00a0carcinogens\u00a0\u2013\u00a0or cancer-causing substances.", "It has also found that\u00a0tattoo inks have been\u00a0\"associated with cancers elsewhere in the body, such as the liver or bladder\".", "According to the Cancer Council: \"Over time, macrophages take up pigment and may transport it into the lymphatic system and lymph nodes. This means other tissue in the body can be exposed to potentially carcinogenic materials in the tattoo ink.\"", "As scientific research directing linking tattoo inks to cancer remains inconclusive,\u00a0the Cancel Council suggests that people ask if the inks being used comply with European standards.", "", "
Chris Rand says regulators \"just don't have the evidence\" to support the ink bans.\u00a0(Supplied)
", "
What do tattoo artists say about safety?
", "Chris Rand, a tattoo artist and treasurer of the Professional Tattooists Association of Australia, told the ABC the new EU laws were \"not workable\" and there wasn't enough evidence of the health risks to justify the ban.\u00a0", "He said professional\u00a0tattoo artists were highly vigilant when it came to ink safety and mainly relied\u00a0on well-established\u00a0brands.\u00a0", "\"If there was\u00a0a problem with a pigment, a tattooist would\u00a0know about it because we're seeing clients over a prolonged period,\" he said.", "\"Some of my clients I've tattooed for 30 years. If there's problems with pigments, you'd get feedback back from the client.\"", "He added that tattooing was\u00a0\"a reputation-based industry\" and that tattooists looked\u00a0out for each other.", "\"You rely on your supply chain, and\u00a0you rely on word of mouth from experienced professionals that have been in the industry a long time on what pigments are safe, and what pigments perform well on the skin,\" he said.\u00a0", "
Regulation tit for tat\u00a0
", "AICIS told the ABC that\u00a0state and territory authorities were responsible for regulating tattoo and permanent\u00a0make-up businesses.", "It said recommendations were made in its\u00a02016 report\u00a0\u2013 which was updated in 2018\u00a0\u2013 that included\u00a0product labelling and restrictions on their use in tattooing.", "Tina\u00a0Viney, chief executive of the Aesthetics Practitioners Advisory Network (APAN), said regulation progress had been made in Australia but the final conclusion shouldn't be rushed.\u00a0", "She believes Australian regulators should follow the EU's lead, but understands commercial needs must be considered.\u00a0", "\"The concern that we have is that from a regulatory perspective, we are very, very conscious of two sides. One is the safety of practitioners and the public, but we do we understand we've got to get the commercial side right,\" she said.\u00a0", "", "
Tina\u00a0Viney says the growing popularity of the tattoo and PMU industry has at times led to the purity and safety of pigments being overlooked.(Supplied)
", "Last year,\u00a0amendments were\u00a0introduced into Queensland Parliament that would have made it an offence for tattoo ink manufacturers and suppliers to provide ink or use it for tattooing without ensuring a compliance analysis certificate had been prepared.", "However, the government was forced to backflip amid outcry from the tattoo community that it would cripple the industry as the\u00a0condition would be \"impossible\" to meet.", "In a Facebook statement at the time, Queensland Health Minister\u00a0Yvette D'Ath agreed it was important to protect both tattoo artists and their clients from harm and hoped there would be\u00a0\"national uniformity on consumer and health issues, such as the tattoo inks\".", "Mr Rand said\u00a0the requirement would have forced those who couldn't comply to tattoo illegally in an underground setting or send\u00a0clients\u00a0to markets in Bali and Thailand instead.", "He suggested that a starting point for regulation would be to limit the supply chain so not just anyone could buy and sell tattoo machines, needles and\u00a0pigment off online platforms like\u00a0Gumtree and eBay.", "\"A lot of manufacturers\u00a0that are in the market have\u00a0come from being tattooers themselves, so they're always looking at new ways to differentiate themselves from the dodgy suppliers,\" he added.", "\"They provide\u00a0medical safety data sheets and\u00a0ingredient lists,\u00a0with all the\u00a0labelling\u00a0given through their websites. These are the kinds of\u00a0measures in place that the industry is coming\u00a0up with themselves.\"", "ABC/wires\u00a0"]
